intraoral scanners brands when receiving scan files what are the top 3 brands of the intra-oral scanners that you receive files from? 24 3shape is top quoted brand for ios scan files received. carestream is very widespread in italy compared to the average in the other countries. 3shape is quoted more than average by bigger sized labs (73%) and so is for dentsply sirona (52%). again, 3shape is quoted more than average by labs equipped with a milling unit (62%) and 3d printer (60%). itero (52%) and medit (35%) are more often quoted among recently open labs. exocad users do show higher than average quotes for itero (46%). dentsply sirona is more than average quoted by labs receiving scan files from more than 50% of their clients (62%). full digital workflow labo base: 524 cases

intraoral scanners brands: recommendation vs scan files reception when asked by the clinician, which intra-oral scanner brand do you recommend most often? what are the top 3 brands of the intra-oral scanners that you receive files from? 25 full digital workflow labo at overall level, a possible relationship between the brand of the ios from which the scan is received and the recommendation of the ios brand has been investigated. the results show that 3shape has the highest relationship between the brand from which the labs receive the scanner and the recommendation. it is also true that 3shape, due to its popularity and seniority in the ios market, has a high frequency of recommendation even in labs receiving scans from other brands. in fact, it is always cited as the second brand regardless of the brand of ios from which the labs receive scans (for carestream it is the first). this also shows that 3shape's reputation is very high. base: 524 cases 3shape dentsply sirona itero medit carestream planmeca 3shape 55% 26% 29% 24% 33% 17% dentsply sirona 12% 30% 9% 5% 7% 13% itero 13% 12% 37% 20% 16% 21% medit 8% 12% 8% 38% 8% 2% carestream 7% 9% 5% 8% 32% 8% planmeca 2% 7% 7% 2% 1% 35% ios brand: received files ios brand: recommendation
1: cad cam experience and user profile sirona is unanimous among dentists as a brand reference; dentists see as an advantage the fact of sirona having a branch in brazil, which makes prices much lower and the proximity with the customer much higher. they also see as an advantage to be able to buy directly from the manufacturer, while for other companies, the purchase is made through a dealer / importer. for those who already had contact with other brands, the technical quality is the same, there is little change in the software design and the convenience of having sirona in brazil makes a great difference. they think they could receive more courses and trainings output focus group users 11

some conclusions 73 the aspects of costs are relevant in the pre-sale, but they do not show to be relevant after the equipment purchase and possible repurchase almost 50% of the sample feels uncomfortable and away from the cad-cam world, specially those who have patients of middle/low classes and with low volume of procedures. regardless the 50% that claim to be away from technology, only 11% claim that technology will not play an important role in the future. less than 2% of the practices in brazil have a chairside unit only about 3% of practices have an intraoral scanner. sirona is spontaneously the most known brand in the cad-cam world, but more than 80% of the sample cannot mention spontaneously a cad-cam manufacturer brand; almost half dentists claim not to know that sirona is a cad-cam manufacturer; sirona brand image in the cad-cam world is much superior between users in terms of those who know it but do not use it. it means that in the market of non-users, sirona has an image position not above the competition. in the process of recommendation to the colleagues, for cad-cam users, aspects regarding the service and proximity the client, which still seem to be in need, are much relevant; in the recommendation process, economical aspects have no weight for those who already are users. about 5% of the dentists interviewed claimed to be willing to invest in cad-cam technology in the next two years, as can be seen in the next slide.

cad-cam manufacturers: unaided awareness which manufacturers (cad-cam) of intraoral scanner and chairside milling unit come to your mind? 52 base: 570 cases total sample the comparison between unaided awareness and top of mind highlights relevant differences in the prominence index, in which a higher value indicates the brand's capacity to represent a products family. 13% of dentists know sirona as a brand, but only 11% of them know it to the point of mentioning it as first brand. the prominence index represents the average number of brands mentioned by each interviewee: the sum of percentage is 127%, i.e., in average, each dental office mentions more than 1 brand. random sample

cad-cam manufacturers: unaided awareness what manufacturers of digital technologies (scanners, cad-cam, 3d print, etc.) come to your mind? 34 random sample the comparison between unaided awareness and top of mind highlights relevant differences in the ability of a brand to represent its own product family, which is shown by the ratio called prominence. a higher prominence value means a higher ability to represent the analysed product family: this in fact is the ratio between the first mentioned brand top of mind and the unaided awareness. the sum of unaided awareness responses represents the average number of brands mentioned by each interviewees: in this case the sum of percentages is 145%, that means the interviewees have mentioned about 1,5 brands. its interesting to note that about 50% of the interviewees did not mention any brand, which is a clear sign of this market being a rather immature one, almost a niche. sirona is absolute brand awareness leader in this segment. base: 455 cases total sample 0,74 0,50 0,48 0,27 0,48 0,55 0,29 0,33 0,22 0,73 sirona 3shape 3m carestream kavo nobel biocare zirkonzahn planmeca dental wings ivoclar vivadent

brand awareness: unaided what manufacturers of the new digital technology world (as scanners, cad-cam, 3d printing, etc.) come to your mind? 31 among laboratories 3shape is the leader in awareness, followed by sirona and 3m. it is worth to mention the presence of nobel biocare as dental implant company but deeply focused on digital restorations, and ivoclar vivadent. spontaneous awareness (unaided): it represents the entire group of brands of a certain product family, recalled by the interviewed sample. within the boundaries of spontaneous awareness, the consumer reasonably decides to make a purchase. base: 722 cases

digital equipment brands: total awareness vs. total awareness digital map for each of the following brands, please state if you know it. 46 the map shows on the vertical axis the total awareness generally speaking, not strictly related to the digital segment, while on the horizontal one there is the ratio between the total awareness focused on the digital segment and the total awareness broadly speaking. the resulting map shows some brands whose total awareness in the digital segment has a high weight on their total awareness broadly speaking. this is true for those brand traditionally related to the digital world. it is interesting to note how some brands, clearly identified as to belong to the digital world, in order to increase their performance, should work on the level of their total awareness broadly speaking (thus moving from the lower to the upper side of the map), and some others, already having a high total awareness, should increase their awareness in the digital world, thus moving towards right in the here shown map. total awareness + incidence total awareness digital on total awareness + base: 281 cases (whole sample) clinic

digital equipment brands: total awareness vs. relevance map for each of the following brands, please state if you know it (as a cad-cam manufacturer). the map showing the total awareness digital and the relevance highlights that dentsply sirona emerges as the brand with the highest ratio between the total and the unaided awareness and the highest total awareness as well. carestream shows a high performance as well, but with a lower awareness quality, since it is less frequently mentioned spontaneously. on the contrary, align technology is less known, but with a higher awareness quality, being mentioned more frequently in a spontaneous way. base: 282 cases (whole sample) total awareness digital + relevance + 44

6: 22 frequency of doctors approaching labs about ios recommendation how often do you get approached by doctors about your recommendation on intra-oral scanner? 30% of dental labs are approached at least monthly. frequency of recommendation increases as the labs size and their digitization level increase. this is also true for labs performing a higher-than-average number of ortho cases with aligners. currently, spain is the country with the lowest penetration of ios but with higher growth rates and in full digitalization process. labo the laboratories state that they are approached by dentists with a certain frequency. a frequent approach is considered to be 'monthly' to 'daily'. although the frequency of approach is fairly homogeneous between countries, spain and france show a higher-than- average overall frequency of 'monthly/weekly/daily'. base: 594 cases cases 137 114 125 113 105

20 frequency of the approaches to doctors about digitization how often do you approach your doctors about digitizing their practice with intraoral scanners? labs receiving intra-oral scan files if never, why? smaller labs bigger labs when the impact of ios scans on the lab business is positive, labs approach doctors more frequently. labs approaching dentists for the practice digitization is quite high, lower than average in the mediterranean countries. in spain, the development of digital technologies in the dental sector has accelerated significantly in the last two years, which is the reason why the percentage of laboratories approaching studies on this subject is high. the reason for not recommending varies with the size of the laboratories: small laboratories do not recommend because they do not feel adequate, while large laboratories, which are the most digitalised ones, are also the ones that can spend less time on this activity. bigger labs higher than average for a frequent approach (46% often). the frequency of the approaches to dentists is higher as the lab overall business trend is positive (43% often). labo base: 524 cases cases 123 108 101 91 101 full digital workflow

23 recommended intraoral scanner brands when asked by the clinician, do you recommend a specific intra-oral scanner brand? which intra-oral scanner brand do you recommend most often? 3shape is quoted more than average among big sized labs (49%), by the lab owners (39%), less recently open structures and those stating the business has decreased (40% and 46% respectively). itero is quoted more than average among more recently open labs (25%) and among labs receiving a high share of scan files (22%). less than average among labs performing a high share of prosthetic complex cases (12%). medit is quoted more than average among labs receiving a lower share of scan files (23%). dentsply sirona is quoted more than average among labs receiving scan files from more than half of clients (20%). labo recommendation is very high: on an overall basis, at least 90% of the laboratories approached by dentists recommend a brand. 3shape is the most recommended brand in spain and italy, while itero is most recommended in the uk. carestream has adopted a very widespread distribution and commercial strategy, which explains the high number of recommendations in italy (achieving a significantly higher penetration than in the other analysed countries). diverse recommended brands across the surveyed countries: 3shape is most quoted, itero is main follower. why do you recommend the mentioned ios brand? (multiple choice) scanner performance and clinic / lab integration are the most quoted reasons. brand reputation is quoted more often among bigger sized labs (62%) and those performing ortho cases with invisible aligners (58%). the latter also quote community more often than average (20%). integration is quoted more often by labs serving a higher number of practices (60%). service / post sales support is more often quoted by labs receiving a higher share of scan files (46%). base: 440 cases

24 barriers for non-owner prospects how much do you consider the following aspects an obstacle to adopting an intraoral scanner in your practice? base: 144 (respondents who do not have ios) mean vote the issue of excessive economic investment represents a serious problem for 33% of the respondents. other marginal issues, such as problems related to internet connectivity and digital reliability in general, are relatively minor, although they are occasionally mentioned in focus groups. the next slide will show the details by country, where there is significant variability in price sensitivity among the three countries: in france, price is a concern for only 20% of respondents, but it is a major issue in spain, where nearly 50% of dentists consider it an obstacle to purchase. the full arches issue is also perceived as a minor one in france but is seen as a serious problem in spain. additionally, in spain, issues related to the mindset of the team and the labs, are considered problematic. the issue of compatibility with a particular brand of aligners is slightly higher in spain, but this topic will be explored in detail later. italians seem to place less importance on economic issues as a barrier to the first purchase. on this sub-target, the three most important elements pertain to the economic area non-owners only among those who do not own a scanner, the phenomenon can be observed in the ratings, which range from 1 to 10 and have been grouped as indicated in the legend. mean vote

7 executive summary ios: limits and barriers among those who do not own a scanner, 30% cite excessive cost as a major issue. internet connectivity and digital reliability are minor concerns. price sensitivity varies by country: 20% in france view price as a significant barrier, while nearly 50% in spain see it as such. full arch scanning is less problematic in france but more relevant in spain. in spain, team mindset and compatibility with laboratories are also significant concerns, along with some issues related to compatibility with aligner brands. usefulness of ios the perceived usefulness of the scanner is high in all analyzed situations, with particular emphasis on time optimization, clinical effectiveness, and internal planning. in spain, the scanner is considered less useful for time optimization compared to other countries, while in italy it is positively evaluated across all areas. in france, the focus is primarily on optimization and clinical effectiveness, with less attention given to communication and marketing. differences between owners and non-owners are evident, especially regarding the use for communication and marketing.

response.0: The most used intraoral scanner brand is 3shape, which is highly recommended and frequently cited by labs. It has a strong reputation and is often mentioned even when labs receive scans from other brands. Other notable brands include Dentsply Sirona and Itero, but 3shape leads in both usage and recommendation.
response.1: 3Shape is a future competitor to Sirona in CAD-CAM equipment. Other notable brands mentioned include 3M and Carestream. The market appears to be somewhat immature, indicating potential for growth among various competitors.
response.2: The brand with the highest ratio between total digital awareness and unaided awareness is Dentsply Sirona. It also has the highest total awareness overall. Carestream follows, but with lower awareness quality.
response.3: In Spain, approximately 37.2% of indirect restorations are produced using a digital workflow. This percentage reflects the share of digital production in the context of overall indirect restorations. The remaining 62.8% are produced using traditional techniques.
response.4: The mean satisfaction score for all CAD-CAM brands in dental labs is 8.1. This reflects an improvement compared to previous years, indicating a higher level of satisfaction among users.
response.6: Spanish dental labs are approached by doctors about intra-oral scanner recommendations at least monthly by approximately 30% of them. The frequency of these approaches increases with the size of the lab and its level of digitization. Overall, Spain experiences a higher-than-average frequency of these inquiries compared to other countries.
response.7: The main reasons dental professionals are hesitant to purchase an intra-oral scanner within the next two years are the high costs and a perceived lack of need for the technology. Additionally, many professionals nearing retirement see little demand for the investment. Preference for traditional methods also plays a role in their decision-making.
response.8: The leading brand of 3D printing unit in Spain is Formlabs, which has a significant market share. Other brands, such as Anycubic, follow but do not match Formlabs' dominance. Overall, Formlabs consistently ranks as the top choice among users in several contexts.
response.9: The most recommended iOS brand in dental labs across Europe is 3shape, particularly favored in Spain and Italy. Itero follows closely, especially in the UK. Overall, 3shape has a strong reputation and is frequently recommended by a significant number of labs.
response.10: The brand with the highest ratio between spontaneous and total notoriety in the digital equipment segment in Spain is 3shape. It is both widely recognized and frequently mentioned as the first brand that comes to mind in this category. Other brands like exocad also show significant notoriety but do not surpass 3shape's ratio.
response.11: There are a total of 179 restorations produced by digital flow prosthesis providers. This includes both traditional and implant prostheses. The average production rate is approximately 3.3 indirect restorations per week per provider.
response.12: The lowest weight on overall satisfaction for 3Shape is associated with items like start-up training, frequency of software updates, and technical assistance in case of repair. These items are in a weaker position and are identified as critical areas for improvement. Despite this, most important items appear to be satisfactory to users.
response.13: Less than 2% of CAD-CAM users in Brazil have a chairside setup. Specifically, 4.7% of those offering CAD-CAM prostheses utilize a chairside system. Overall, only 42% of CAD-CAM users provide CAD-CAM prostheses.
response.14: The most common in-house CAD/CAM milling unit brand is Dentsply Sirona, with an average year of purchase around 2016. This brand leads the market significantly ahead of its competitors.
response.15: France has the highest percentage of weight of optical impressions out of the total impressions taken in a practice, reaching 69.2%. Spain follows closely with 66.5%. Germany has the lowest percentage at 49.5%.
response.16: Spain shows the most issues related to biases and stereotypes, particularly concerning economic barriers and team mindset. Nearly 50% of dentists in Spain consider excessive cost a significant obstacle, and there are notable concerns about compatibility with laboratories and aligners. These issues highlight the variability in perceptions and challenges faced within the country compared to others.
response.17: 31% of laboratories with three or more technicians plan to start providing fixed prosthetics using digital technologies within the next year. This indicates a significant interest in adopting digital methods among larger laboratories. The percentage reflects an increase in intention compared to previous years.
response.18: The penetration of dental scanners in the sample of European dental laboratories is reported to be 84%. In contrast, for dental practices using digital technologies, the penetration of intraoral scanners is around 20%. Additionally, 55% of laboratories have scanners for sending scan files outside.
response.19: 18% of Spanish laboratories that do not currently provide dental restorations plan to start offering fixed prosthesis elements produced with digital technologies in the next year. This percentage increases among larger laboratories and those with a positive outlook on their business.
response.20: The main reason for digital equipment users in Germany to use their in-lab milling scanner and base is that it simplifies daily practice and improves the quality of restorations. Additionally, users appreciate the increased efficiency and broader range of procedures available. Flexibility and convenience are also considered important but to a lesser extent.
response.21: Approximately 16.8% of production is made by partner laboratories for dentists in Italy. Additionally, 44.8% is produced by manufacturers. The remaining production is divided among in-house and outsourcing methods.
response.22: The penetration of dental scanners in the sample of dental laboratories varies by country, with Germany and France at 84%, Italy at 81%, Spain at 71%, and the UK at 85%. The desktop scanner shows the highest penetration among dental labs. Key brands include 3shape, medit, dental wings, and dentsply sirona, with 3shape being particularly prominent in larger labs.
response.23: 48% of European partner lab users also send their models or scan files to a manufacturer or milling center. This highlights a significant overlap between the two channels. Additionally, 11% of these users also perform in-lab milling.
response.24: In Italy, 16% of elements are made with optical impressions. Traditional impressions account for 83%, while 7% are produced using chairside systems.
response.25: Bego has a higher than average reputation in terms of trustworthiness. However, it is perceived as being quite expensive compared to other brands. Overall, while Bego is recognized for its quality, affordability is a concern among customers.
response.26: On average, laboratories produce about 7.9 composite elements for fixed prosthesis per week. This figure reflects a trend of increasing production in recent years. The production can vary based on the techniques used and the size of the laboratory.
response.27: 16% of elements made with optical impressions are produced in-house in Italy. This percentage reflects the overall production share by technology and channel. The majority of optical impressions are likely sourced from external providers.
